Sentencas: World-wide a number of activities are concerned with the optimisation and development of cell materials and microstructures with the aim of reducing the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operating temperature.
Titulo: Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century

Sentencas: Advantages for reduced operating temperatures are considered to be longer life time and reduced costs of the total system.
Titulo: Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century

Sentencas: Conventional zirconia based electrolyte cells with highly optimised electrodes have produced 500 mA/cm(2) at 700 mV and 800 degrees C. At a similar temperature and cell potential, small scale, co-fired, electrode supported thin-electrolyte cells have produced 700 mA/cm(2).
Titulo: Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century

Sentencas: For SOFC operation at temperatures below 750 degrees C the conventional 8 mol% Y2O3-ZrO2 electrolyte is replaced with either Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 (10GCO) or La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.2O3 (LSGM) electrolytes.
Titulo: Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century

Sentencas: Up-scaled 10 x 10 cm(2) or 12 cm circular 10GCO and LSGM cells have been manufactured and the initial results of cell tests are very promising.
Titulo: Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century
Intermediate temperature SOFC - a promise for the 21st century
